strings.onboardShortDescription: The heart of the Indian Ocean
strings.onboardLongDescription: Peruse the various museums and mosques, indulge at the variety of restaurants and world renowned street food carts, find hidden treasures at the eclectic shops and even bring your best hat for a day at Champs de Mars, a horse racing track.

agendaPreview.noBookingText: You don’t currently have any bookings for this day. Go ahead and fill your boots!

activities.longDescription: Learn about Mauritius' colonial past on this e-bike ride through the Pamplemousses region. Start with a ride through sugar cane fields to the village of Pamplemousses, where you'll have a view of Le Pouce and Pieter mountain ranges. Then head to the colonial house of Villebague, before visiting Le Mount sugar mill. On the return journey, ride through the historic district of Pamplemousses to L’Aventure du Sucre, where you will enjoy snacks and refreshments.
highlightDetails: Snacks and refreshments at le Fangourin restaurant
See the Saint-François Presbyterian Church, the old cemetery, and the slave pool, on your way back through the Pamplemousses district
Visit Le Mount sugar mill
See the colonial house of Villebague, the former residence of Mahé de La Bourdonnais
Stop at Le Pouce and Pieter mountain range viewpoint
E-bike tour through the Pamplemousses region
activities.introduction: Take a thrilling, picturesque e-bike ride through sugar cane fields and Mauritius.
instructionDetails: Views are weather dependent
Sailors should know how to ride a bike
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate
Closed-toed shoes are required
Approximately 28km of biking
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Sailors must wear suitable clothing and footwear for this activity (hiking, biking, trekking, rappelling, ziplining, yoga, etc.)

activities.shortDescription: A scenic aerial tour of Mauritius by helicopter
activities.longDescription: This 40-minute helicopter flight will give you a bird's eye view of Mauritius' most beautiful landscapes and landmarks. From above, see the city of Port-Louis, lagoons, the Albion Lighthouse, the mountains of Le Morne Brabant and Le Pieter Both, the Black River Gorges, and even an underwater waterfall.

activities.shortDescription: Discover the historic town of Curepipe
activities.longDescription: Explore Curepipe, the second largest town in Mauritius, on this panoramic tour. First, stop at Trou Aux Cerfs, a dormant volcano crater with stunning 360-degree views over the central plateau. Then head to Voiliers de l'Ocean, a ship model factory and shop with some of the finest local crafts. Drive through Curepipe seeing its most notable landmarks before heading inland to some more rural sights at Grand Basin Sacred Lake and Black River National Park.
highlightDetails: Lunch will be at a beautiful cliffside restaurant where they will enjoy the views of Le Morne and Baie du Cap
Cross through Black River National Park
Grand Bassin Sacred Lake, a natural crater lake and main pilgrimage site for Hindus
Drive through Curepipe to see Town Hall, Arcades Currimjee, Royal College, and St. Therese Church
Visit Voiliers de l'Ocean, a ship model factory
Views from Trou Aux Cerfs dormant volcano crater
See the colonial buildings and gardens of Curepipe
activities.introduction: Get a comprehensive tour of the 19th-century town of Curepipe, known for its colonial buildings and gardens.

activities.shortDescription: A tour of Port Louis and the Eureka Colonial House
activities.longDescription: Begin the day at the Victorian-era Port Louis Bazaar, the oldest market on Mauritius. After browsing the food, herbal potions, handcrafts, and clothes, head to the Caudan Waterfront, a waterfront mall known for its art exhibitions, restaurants, and boutique shops. You'll also see historical sites in town like the Municipal Theater, Place d'Armes, Government House, and Saint Louis Cathedra. End the day with a tour of the 19th-century Colonial House, one of the island's oldest colonial houses.
highlightDetails: Relax on Eureka Colonial House terrace with soft drinks and local snacks
Guided tour of the 19th-century Eureka Colonial House, one of the oldest colonial houses on Mauritius
Visit the church of Marie Reine de La Paix
See historical sites like Place d'Armes, Supreme Court, Municipal Theater, Government House, and Saint Louis Cathedral
Caudan Waterfront mall, known for its art exhibitions, restaurants, casino, and entertainment venues
Port Louis Bazaar, the oldest market on Mauritius
activities.introduction: Explore all the cultural charms of Port Louis, including art exhibitions, theaters, and cathedrals, before heading to the Eureka Colonial House.

activities.shortDescription: A catamaran sailing under the tropical sun
activities.longDescription: Join your catamaran near the fishing village of Trou'Eau Douce, and spend the day sailing under the tropical sun. You'll have the opportunity to snorkel in the peaceful waters of Eau Bleu or Baie des 2 frères, before taking a ferryboat to the waterfall of Grande Rivière Sud Est. Enjoy a BBQ lunch onboard the catamaran while taking in the breathtaking landscape. End the day with a stopover at Ile aux Cerfs for some sunbathing.
highlightDetails: Stop in Ile aux Cerfs for sunbathing and beach time
BBQ onboard the catamaran
Ferryboat to waterfall of Grande Rivière Sud Est
Snorkel at Eau Bleu or Baie des 2 frères
Go sailing in a luxurious catamaran
activities.introduction: Take a tranquil catamaran journey along the island's east coast, complete with water activities and onboard BBQ.
instructionDetails: Sailors prone to motion sickness should take precautions prior to this Shore Thing

Access to the waterfall is via small boat, so Sailors will need to be able to climb in/out with little assistance

activities.longDescription: Start the day with a drive north to the small village of Cap Malheureux, before heading to Domaine da Labourdonnais, a private estate dating back to the 1700s. Surrounded by orchards, the estate now specializes in rum distillation and the production of fruit juices -- both of which you can taste. Then, head to the Beau Plan sugar factory museum where you'll learn about the island's sugar-making tradition. Finish the day at the Pamplemousses Botanical Garden, and with views from Adelaide Fort.
highlightDetails: Panoramic views of the capital city from Adelaide Fort
Tour of Pamplemousses Botanical Garden
Lunch at Le Fangourin restaurant
Beau Plan sugar factory museum
Visit the Domaine de Labourdonnais estate for rum and fruit tasting
Drive to the village of Cap Melheureux
activities.introduction: A driving tour of the beautiful landmarks and landscapes in the north of Mauritius.
instructionDetails: Sailors should advise of any dietary restrictions or allergies in advance of the experience

Alcoholic beverages of any kind purchased in any Port-of-Call will be retained at the gangway, stored on board and held until the end of the voyage

activities.shortDescription: Kayak to Tamarin Bay, where the river & ocean meet
activities.longDescription: After a scenic drive to the charming village of Tamarin, gear up and board your kayak to explore Tamarin Bay. Enjoy views of the nearby mountains as you paddle through the calm waters. You'll learn all about the local ecosystem as you glide through the lush greenery that offers natural sanctuary for the abundant wildlife that call the area home. Enjoy a refreshment break on the beach and soak up the last views of Mauritius before returning to the pier.
highlightDetails: Enjoy a refreshment break on a beach along Tamarin Bay
Take in beautiful views of Trois Mamelles Mountain and La Tourelle Mountain
Learn about the unique wildlife that call this area home
Pass through the charming village of Tamarin and discover its unique history
activities.introduction: Discover the important ecosystem of Tamarin Bay, home to a one of the last wild sanctuaries on Mauritius, on this kayak tour.
instructionDetails: This Shore Thing uses double kayaks; solo Sailors will be paired up
Sailors should consider their physical fitness level and medical history when determining whether this Shore Thing is appropriate
Sailors in wheelchairs or with limited mobility should not select this Shore Thing
Approximately 45 minute drive each way to/from the pier
Wildlife sightings are likely but not guaranteed

activities.shortDescription: A historic and cultural tour of Mauritius
activities.longDescription: Your heritage tour begins in the Domaine des Aubineaux, a colonial mansion dating back to the 1800s, just a few steps from the buzzing town of Curepipe. Then visit the Bois Chéri tea estate, the first tea plantation in Mauritius, to learn about the history of the tea industry on the island and taste some teas. Enjoy lunch at the plantation house of Saint Aubin, and end the day with a rum and sugar tasting at a local distillery.
highlightDetails: Rum and sugar tasting at local distillery
Visit an anthurium greenhouse
Lunch at the plantation house of Saint Aubin
Learn about the island's tea history, and taste local blends, at the Bois Chéri tea estate
Visit Les Aubineaux, a 19th-century colonial mansion
activities.introduction: Get a taste of Mauritius' culinary and cultural heritage on this historic tour.
